- UID: 9e044c1d-0d29-4760-b62e-9a05f4c49247

- Topic: Gasoline Surcharge Amendment
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to amend Chapter 162 of the Code of the City of New Orleans by including an additional $1.00 gasoline surcharge for each completed trip authorized from the passage of the ordinance until December 31, 2022. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,825
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with the support of all council members.
- Tags/Keywords: Gasoline Surcharge, Amendment, City Code
- UID: 9e044c1d-0d29-4760-b62e-9a05f4c49247
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 9-1-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Budget Allocation for Alternative Dispatch Program
- Summary: An ordinance to transfer funding from the Office of Youth and Families to the New Orleans Health Department to support the alternative dispatch program. These funds were allocated by the Louisiana Legislature to the City of New Orleans in the 2021 legislative session for economic development, educational, housing, and public safety initiatives.
- Ordinance Number: 33833 - 29154 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, and funding was transferred to support the alternative dispatch program.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget Allocation, Funding Transfer, Alternative Dispatch Program
- UID: ab32c33c-6580-4f80-9704-78c94ea85f6d

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with BioDistrict New Orleans
- Summary: An ordinance authorizing the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City of New Orleans and the BioDistrict New Orleans.
- Ordinance Number: 33834 - 29155 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, allowing the Mayor to enter into the Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with BioDistrict New Orleans.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, BioDistrict New Orleans, Mayor Authorization
- UID: ab32c33c-6580-4f80-9704-78c94ea85f6d

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Economic Development District Cooperative Endeavor Agreement
- Summary: The ordinance proposed the creation of an Economic Development District Cooperative Endeavor Agreement within the District of New Orleans to induce economic development and enhance bioscience and health products. The ordinance was withdrawn.
- Ordinance Number: 33844
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was withdrawn.

- Topic: Waiver of Fees for Silence the Violence Youth Talent Show and Festival
- Summary: This ordinance proposed the temporary waiver of certain fees and permit requirements for an event at Washington Square Park. The ordinance was amended and passed with unanimous support.
- Ordinance Number: 33845
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1 (Amendment): Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Establishment of Billing Procedures for Sewerage and Water Board of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to ordain Chapter 159 and Sections 159-1 through 159-3 to establish the billing procedures for the Sewerage and Water Board of New Orleans. The ordinance was received and added to the rules, with Councilmembers Moreno and Morrell as the primary movers.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,832
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was received and added to the rules. Climate/Utilities and SWBNO Advisory Committees recommended approval.
- Tags/Keywords: Sewerage and Water Board, Billing Procedures, New Orleans

- Topic: Reservation of Public Roadway for Non-Motorized Vehicles
- Summary: The ordinance R-22-391 proposed that no portion of the public roadway shall be reserved exclusively for use by bicycles or other non-motorized vehicles. The ordinance was withdrawn.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-391
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was withdrawn.
- Tags/Keywords: Public Roadway, Non-Motorized Vehicles, Reservation, Withdrawn

- Topic: Renewable Portfolio Standards
- Summary: The ordinance R-22-392 pertained to a rulemaking proceeding to establish renewable portfolio standards. It covered compliance years 2023-2025 for Entergy New Orleans LLC. The resolution and order establishing a procedural schedule regarding Entergy's compliance plan was submitted electronically with a postponement deadline of 12/30/22.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-392
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution and order establishing a procedural schedule was submitted electronically with a postponement deadline of 12/30/22.
- Tags/Keywords: Renewable Portfolio Standards, Entergy New Orleans LLC, Compliance Plan, Procedural Schedule
- UID: 080e842a-7d99-4fba-b241-e59e20fd0032

- Topic: Amendment of Budgets for Various Departments in French Quarter Economic Development District Trust Fund
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the budgets for the New Orleans Police Department, Department of Public Works, Chief Administrative Office, and Department of Public Safety in the French Quarter Economic Development District Trust Fund. It was electronically submitted and introduced by Councilmember King.
- Ordinance Number: 33,847
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion passed, and the ordinance was introduced and laid over as required by law.

- Topic: Amendment to Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Hurricane Recovery Efforts
- Summary: This ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into Amendment No. 4 to the Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the State of Louisiana for recovery efforts from Hurricane Katrina and Rita-damaged public facilities and infrastructures. It was introduced by Councilmember King by request.
- Ordinance Number: 33,848
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion passed, and the ordinance was introduced and laid over as required by law.

- UID: 14113e86-3030-4934-8635-84a39e9446d4

- Topic: Conditional Use for Small Childcare Center in S-RD Suburban Two-Family Residential District
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to establish a conditional use to permit a small childcare center in an S-RD Suburban Two-Family Residential District. It was introduced by Councilmember Thomas.
- Ordinance Number: 33,849
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)

- Tags/Keywords: Conditional use, childcare center, zoning, S-RD Suburban Two-Family Residential District

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: The ordinance proposes to grant an amendment to allow a two-way curb cut along Lafitte Street through a waiver of Article 18, Section 18.17.C.3. in a specific municipal district. 
- Ordinance Number: 33,850
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with unanimous support from the council members.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Amendment, Lafitte Street, Municipal District
- UID: 1f166efe-0676-4ec4-8b8f-312673de40a3

- Topic: Conditional Use for Bar Establishment
- Summary: This ordinance aims to establish a conditional use to permit a bar in specific historic and commercial districts in the Third Municipal District.
- Ordinance Number: 33,851
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 1 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with majority support, with one council member voting against it.

- UID: 1f166efe-0676-4ec4-8b8f-312673de40a3

- Topic: Conditional Use for Artist Studio
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to establish a conditional use to permit a neighborhood commercial establishment for an artist studio in specific historic and urban districts in the First Municipal District.
- Ordinance Number: 33,852
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with majority support, but there were two council members who voted against it.
- Tags/Keywords: Conditional Use, Artist Studio, Historic Urban Corridor
- UID: 1f166efe-0676-4ec4-8b8f-312673de40a3
